The Leaders in Transforming Academic Data into Decision-Making Power

MeasureOne was formed by a team of developers passionate about opening opportunities for the more than 30M emerging consumers with little or no financial history. We recognized the potential for a wide range of businesses in building relationships with the "thin-filed," and set about determining how academic data – the one source of information these future consumers *did* create – could be used to help businesses make educated decisions on their behalf.

We built relationships with more than 7,000 transcript providers. Got to know their curricula and the myriad formats of their transcripts. We developed a process to extract and transform academic information. Created mechanisms to normalize the diverse forms and formats, classes and credits, semesters and grades, into a standardized, analyzable data set – one that could signal these students' future financial, and other performance-based, behaviors.

Then we made it available. Our simple API and user-friendly interface means that businesses of every type can use academic data in their applications and decisions. That emerging consumer can transform their academic achievements into concrete credentials. That the two can come together with greater confidence and transparency.

We built MeasureOne to unlock the power of academic data: fueling insights, products and services that open new opportunities for businesses and emerging consumers.

The MeasureOne API: Unlocking the Power of Academic Data

Transforming Academic Data to Performance Insights

Academic data has been plagued with a host of idiosyncrasies and inconsistencies that has limited its usefulness. An institution may provide HTML transcript files with no identifying column headings, or PDF files with data in multiple columns. Or worse, scanned images of marginal quality. But that's just the beginning.

There is remarkably little standardization from one academic institution to another. From credit systems, to grading systems, to term structure, the combination of variables when comparing transcript is astounding.

We created a means of extracting and transforming this unstructured data and operational variables into useful, accessible insights – finally translating academic performance into predictable future behaviors.
